page.title: 02The School
page.content: The school is called Fir Ends because the previous building was originally built at the end of a large Fir wood and when the new school was built the governors and head wished to retain the old name. The school serves three parishes, Kirklinton,Scaleby and Hethersgill.Originally it only served Kirklinton and Scaleby but due to falling numbers Hethersgill school closed in 1984 and the catchment area of Fir Ends was extended to include Hethersgill. The school was built to hold 83 pupils and in 1985 has a population of 79.These are taught by the headmaster, two full-time teachers and two part-time.It is a primary school and takes children from the age of 4+ to 11. At the age of 11 children move on to Secondary schools nearby.
